page.title: 17EDUCATION
page.content: necessity for this had passed, the school was closed. For a while it housed the local Theatre-in-Education group 'Theatrevan'. Later it was used as a Secondary Schools' Tutorial Unit but has now been taken over by a com- puter firm, ITEC. The two Little Parndon schools were some of the first to be built in the town and are now nearly thirty years old. Photograph D actually shows the Infants School; the Junior School is to the right of the photo. Both schools share the same site, which is almost certainly the best in the new town. The playing fields run into the woods which border the site on its south side, and give it one of the most attractive backgrounds to a school in a largely urban area.
